required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Pre- and Post-discharge Initiation of LCZ696 Therapy in HFrEF Patients After an Acute Decompensation Event
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Open Label, Parallel Group Study Comparing Pre-discharge and posT-discharge tReatment Initiation With LCZ696 in heArt Failure patieNtS With Reduced ejectIon-fracTion hospItalized for an Acute decOmpensation eveNt (ADHF)

brief_summary.textblock: To explore two modalities of treatment initiation (Pre-discharge, and Post-discharge) with LCZ696 in HFrEF patients following stabilization after an ADHF episode.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients who are receiving 200 mg LCZ696 bid
primary_outcome.description: Assessing the percentage of patients who achieve the target dose of 200 mg bid LCZ696 at 10 weeks after randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who achieved and maintained either the dose of 100 mg and/or 200 mg LCZ696 bid for at least 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing number of patients achieving and maintaining either dose of 100 mg and/or 200 mg LCZ696 bid for at least 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who, regardless of previous dose changes, achieved any dose of LCZ696 bid for at least 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing number of patients achieving and maintaining any dose of LCZ696 bid for at least 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients permanently discontinued from treatment due to Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients permanently discontinued from LCZ696 (1) up to week-10, and (2) up to week 26, due to AEs

clinical_study.condition: Heart Failure With Reduced Ejection Fraction (HFrEF)

arm_group.description: Patients randomized to Pre-discharge treatment initiation could receive first dose of LCZ696 at any point after the investigator deemed the patient to be stable for at least 24 h, relatively to the ongoing acute HF-therapy.
Patients randomized to Post-discharge treatment initiation could receive the first LCZ696 dose at any point between the day after discharge and up to 14 days after Discharge.

intervention.description: The target dose of LCZ696 is 200 mg twice daily. Starting dose of LCZ696 is either 50 or 100 mg, twice daily. The dose of LCZ696 should be doubled every 2-4 weeks to achieve the target dose of 200 mg twice daily, as tolerated by the patient.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients hospitalized due to acute decompensated HF episode (ADHF) as primary diagnosis) and consistent Signs & Symptoms
2. Diagnosis of HF New York Heart Association class II-to-IV and reduced ejection fraction: Left ventricular ejection fraction ≤ 40% at Screening
3. Patients did not receive any IV vasodilators (except nitrates), and/or any IV inotropic therapy from the time of presentation for ADHF to Randomization
4. Stabilized (while in the hospital) for at least 24 hours leading to Randomization.
5. Meeting one of the following criteria:
- Patients on any dose of ACEI or ARB at screening
- ACEI/ARB naïve patients and patients not on ACEI or ARB for at least 4 weeks before screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of hypersensitivity to the sacubitril, valsartan, or any ARBs, NEP inhibitors or to any of the LCZ696 excipients.
2. Symptomatic hypotension and/or a SBP below 110 mm Hg or SBP above 180 mm Hg prior to randomization
3. End stage renal disease at Screening; or estimated GFR below 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 (as measured by MDRD formula at Randomization.
4. Serum potassium above 5.4 mmol/L at Randomization.
5. Known history of hereditary or idiopathic angioedema or angioedema related to previous ACE inhibitor or ARB therapy
6. Severe hepatic impairment, biliary cirrhosis and cholestasis

clinical_study.keyword: Acute decompensated heart failure, reduced ejection fraction, pre-discharge treatment, post-discharge treatment, angiotensin receptor neprilysine inhibitor.
